newsitem.title: GERMANY: Spar ups sales, profit, dividend for 1996.
newsitem.headline: Spar ups sales, profit, dividend for 1996.

text.p: German retail group Spar Handels AG, publishing final 1996 results, said on Friday that group net profits rose by 43.9 percent to 107.5 million marks ($63.6 million) on sales up 5.3 percent to 13.1 billion marks.
The company also said it planned to pay a dividend of 50 pfennigs on ordinary shares, up from 35 pfennigs in 1995. The payout on preferred shares would rise to 62 pfennigs from 47.5.
The sales figure was before payment of turnover taxes.
The earnings figure was slightly higher than a preliminary group net profit of 105 million marks announced in March.
The planned ordinary dividend payout was also 10 pfennigs higher than signalled in March, while the payout on preferred shares was up from a proposed 52.5 pfennigs.

A group led by France's Intermarche sellers' group, the Swiss-based NHH Norddeutsche Handels Holding GmbH, announced it had bought a 75 percent stake in Spar earlier this week. NHH itself is controlled by Intermarche unit ITM Entreprises SA.
